scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: This folder comprises several letters to and/or from members of the Morgan family; a 1933 calendar from the Near East Foundation; postcards from the New Capital Hotel in Frankfort, Kentucky, with a portrait of Confederate General John Hunt Morgan and a brief story of his famous raid; checks written by Ellen "Nellie" Key Howard Morgan; and several receipts and bills documenting purchases made by Nellie K.H. Morgan. Most of the letters are either to or from Nellie K.H. Morgan regarding lawsuit involving the Morgan heirs' land in Menifee County, Kentucky, including details about expenses, a low settlement offer, a new offer for purchase by the United States Forest Service, and land examinations for the sale.
